page.title: 05The library in Stockwood
page.content: It took 16 years to decide if {Stockwood}should have a library or not. It was opened on Weds 28th. Oct.1981. It has 25000 books for you to choose from. There are two sections, adults and childrens. There is a pre-school story time every Friday at 14.30 hours. In an average day 100-150 people visit the library. They have a choice of magazines, books or tapes. The period of loan for adults is 3 weeks. There is a library photographer and at present he is doing an exhibition about Stockwood. The local readers contribute a small exhibition each week. Quite a lot of people go to the library to study or read daily newspapers.
